update.description:
This moves the `*.proto` message description files into a `proto` subdirectory which is symmetrical to the `include` subdirectory that headers are located in. This should make the filesystem less confusing to navigate.

The diff is enormous, but almost all of the changes are simply moving files. The only changes which aren't a simple file move are [a couple lines in `src/CMakeLists.txt`](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/45/move-proto-files-into-a-more-explicit/diff#chg-src/CMakeLists.txt).

~~To avoid creating a diff which is impossible to review, we should wait to merge this until pull request #40 is merged, then we should retarget this PR to the `default` branch.~~ This is ready for merging.

content.raw: Interestingly, Gazebo has been installing `proto` files under a separate folder, i.e. `/usr/local/include/gazebo-7/gazebo/msgs/proto/`, but Ignition messages proto files are ending up on the same directory as the cpp code: `/usr/local/include/ignition/msgs0/ignition/msgs/`
content.html: Interestingly, Gazebo has been installing proto files under a separate folder, i.e. /usr/local/include/gazebo-7/gazebo/msgs/proto/, but Ignition messages proto files are ending up on the same directory as the cpp code: /usr/local/include/ignition/msgs0/ignition/msgs/

pull_request.title: Move proto files into a more explicit subdirectory

pullrequest.title: Move proto files into a more explicit subdirectory

content.raw: The `include` path is where they used to be installed. That still seems reasonable.
content.html: The include path is where they used to be installed. That still seems reasonable.

pull_request.title: Move proto files into a more explicit subdirectory

pullrequest.title: Move proto files into a more explicit subdirectory

content.raw:
I believe you're right. The generated headers get installed, but not the proto files.

I imagine that's an issue if anyone wants to write their own proto message that leverages a message from `ign-msgs`.

Do we want to install them to `include/.../ignition/msgs` or to something like `share/.../ignition/msgs`?
content.html:
I believe you're right. The generated headers get installed, but not the proto files.

I imagine that's an issue if anyone wants to write their own proto message that leverages a message from ign-msgs.

Do we want to install them to include/.../ignition/msgs or to something like share/.../ignition/msgs?

content.html: Actually, I think the proto files are no longer installed as of pull request #40
